titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater, Accession 2017:076
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater, Accession 2017:076 FA1351
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-01-10 00:01:54 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater, Accession 2017:076

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Verne S. Atwater joined the Ford Foundation as the first director of administration in 1956, and held several positions in his 12 years with the Foundation. In 1962, he became the representative for Argentina and Chile in Buenos Aires and then was promoted to director of the Latin America and Caribbean program. He was elected vice president in 1966, and he held administrative responsibility for the construction of the Ford Foundation's new headquarters building. When the building was completed in 1968, Atwater returned to his career in education and finance. He is a co-author of the book A Memoir of The Ford Foundation: The Early Years, 1936-1938.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series: Subject Files, 1964-1968, as received from the Ford Foundation in 2017.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Ford Foundation in 2017 and ingested by RAC as Accession 2017:076.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, reports, financial statements, and meeting minutes related to the Ford Foundation's administrative activities, organizational structure, and new building project. The collection also houses reports and correspondence related to the Satellite Project, a Ford Foundation initiative to build a satellite to broadcast educational television programs.

p.extref: [A memoir of ] the Ford Foundation : the early years 1936-1968, an insider view of the impact of wealth and good intentions
